page.title: 13THE LOCAL POLICEMAN
page.content: The local policeman, stationed in Wray, covers the villages of Wray, Wennington and Lowgill and is governed by Lancashire Division, the second largest in England. Working hours are from 8 am to midnight on a shift basis. When off-duty he is covered by policemen from Lancaster. Personal radio provides the link with Lancaster and also with the force headquarters at Hutton. The basic role of the rural policeman is more to prevent than to solve crime. He patrols in his own car, receiving an allowance, and his physical presence acts as a deterrent to possible offenders. In addition to the usual function of the policeman those in rural areas must act as "jacks of all trades" in dealing with road traffic, various agricultural regulations and wildlife preservation matters including poaching.
